page.title: 03THE EXPANSION OF NORTHAMPTON
page.content: On the 19th June we visited BBC Radio Northampton to gather local news.They told us that fifteen years ago this was a small market town of 100,000 people. Now it is a development town of 180,000 and still growing.The Government grants allowed the expansion to take place but these have come to an end this year.The Development Corporation which was set up to manage these grants was disbanded in April and responsibility handed back to the Borough.Expansion is to continue with the building of roads through Far Cotton to St.Peter's Way,Spencer Bridge Road to the Weedon Road,Regent Square and Abington Street.New housing estates are being built in the southern area all the way to the M1 Motorway.At the end of our visit we were given souvenir pens,car stickers,badges and sticky bugs.Then we went along to see people at the Chronicle & Echoe and the Post.
